title: Places Dominated in 06 Euro Trip
name: Places Dominated in 06 Euro Trip
description:
A Map by Wlivsey

Last summer I went backpacking through Europe with 3 friends having the time of my life. Im from England but I never traveled through Europe because I lived here most my life. The trip was full of ups in downs including fights, pub crawls, and pickpocketting. Overall the trip made made me confident in myself anywhere in the world and I couldn't have done it in  better places.

properties.name: 49 Comyn Road, London HQ
properties.description: Posted by WlivseyHere we have my aunt and uncles place in London just a block away from Clapham Junction. This house is always the start in my Europe travels because its easy to get there from the airport and a good place to fight jetlag. My travel buddies rested up here before heading to London Waterloo station to take Eurostar to Paris.

properties.name: Barcelona Beach
properties.description: Posted by Wlivsey  Heres the beach where we camped out at for a day just chilling in the sun and drinking local beers. We all took a nap passing out for a couple hours and probably got skin cancer.

properties.name: Haytor House
properties.description: Posted by WlivseyThe Haytor House is my grandparents\'s 16th century stone manor in the middle of the Bampton town square. The house has stone floors, servants quarters, and a courtyard as well as a side cottage that they lease out to people. http://www.cotswolds.info/accommodation/bampton-lodgings.shtml heres the link to the cottage for rentals with pics. I actually lived there for almost a year when we moved from London. We came to the house before and after our Euro adventure to recoup.

properties.name: James's Nan's place
properties.description: Posted by WlivseyFinishing up our English leg of the trip we managed to take a train up north to visit his grandma. With all my family living south its always a shock to go up north and see the people. They are almost a different breed with sing song accents. It may not be the nicest area in England to live but you really see how the common working people interact with one another and that there is much more unity with these people than your average Londoner.

properties.name: Lausanne Swiss Run
properties.description: Posted by WlivseyAfter Venice we were Paris bound again to get back to the UK. Our Euro Rail passes we\'re only good for France, Italy, and Spain. Somehow when the ticket inspector came he was clueless to this fact and we weren\'t booted off. Lausanne was beautiful with Lake Geneva and the mountains right there. This was also special because my mom lived out here when she visited her grandfather on ski trips.

properties.name: Marsailles Train Station Fight
properties.description: Posted by WlivseyStarting all the way back at the Spanish-French border, a drunken tramp got on the train and kept harassing people for change. I had him kicked off once but he snuck back on the train and when I woke up around Marsailles I found him trying to steal my bag. My friend and I confronted him and he refused to believe the bag was ours so I started punching him and knocking him around and then threw him off the train when we pulled into a station right infront of a guard. It then looked like i was beating up on an old man but the guard quickly learned he was drunk and trying to take my bag and he was hauled off for good.

properties.name: Mercur Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Wlivsey Paris, beautiful, extravagant, expensive. We decided to do Paris on a budget and sneak into the sheik Mercur Hotel with our backpacks on and everything and sleep on the floor with my travel buddy\'s cousin who just so happened to be over at the time. French hotel rooms are tiny so I slept under a table, one guy slept in the bathroom, and the other partly on the balconey.

properties.name: Rome Pub Crawl Beginning
properties.description: Posted by WlivseyAfter hitting up all the Rome tourist spots my fellow travelers and I were told of a nightly pub crawl across the city. We met up at these church stairs were the pub crawl starts and began the 1 hour of unlimited drinks. We came along with these Austrailians we met on the train to Rome and had a great night going from bar to bar. There was some cultural exchange with the Aussies teaching us the drinking game "cheers buffalo" where if you are caught holding your drink with your right hand and you are "cheers buffalo\'d" then you have to down your drink immediately. Us yanks suffered terrible loses learning this game right on these steps however we\'ve brought the game to the U.S which has started to spread on campus.

properties.name: The Club
properties.description: Posted by WlivseyAfter having some rounds of scotch at the hotel we decided that we need to enjoy the night life of Paris with some club action. My friends cousin told us of this nice club on the Champ de Elysees that she went to. However she didn\'t know that they change themes everynight and it just so happened to be Dancing Queen. Due to our conditions we didn\'t figure this out for quit a bit when we noticed girls didn\'t like to dance with us while the fellas got kinda close. When we ran out of the club the Metro was closed and we refused to pay for a taxi so we walked to our hotel at 3am on the Paris streets all the way back.

properties.name: Venice Trainstation
properties.description: Posted by WlivseyWe arrived in Paris at 4am with the Aussies we met. Instead of finding a place to stay we basically camped out in the trainstation. After a long day around the city the Aussies left to go to their Eastern European leg while we stayed in the trainstation and left in the morning. I had to be frugal at this point since my wallet had been jacked in Barcelona. No gelatie for me.
